availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter P. Elliott (Hickman County, Kentucky, editor.)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, editor. Virginia native. Married to Susan J. Eddings Elliott in Wilson County, Tennessee, in 1837. Father of William J. Elliott, Lucetta Elliott, Emmett Elliott, Florence Elliott, and Arthur L. Elliott. Saddler in Gibson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Gibson County in 1850. Editor in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Gibson County, Trenton, p. 271B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Gibson County, Trenton.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 473.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Gibson County, District 4, p. 318A.
Tennessee, County Marriages, 1790-1950, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Wilson County Marriages, Film 000430834.
"P.P. Elliott (1807-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 118394085, accessed July 26, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118394085.
